body:
The stats block at the end of the transfer has almost all of this info in

```
$ rclone sync -v --dry-run src dst
[snip]
2020/09/25 11:20:17 INFO  : 
Transferred:   	         0 / 0 Bytes, -, 0 Bytes/s, ETA -
Checks:               999 / 999, 100%
Deleted:                1
Transferred:            1 / 1, 100%
Elapsed time:         0.0s
```

It doesn't contain the sizes of the transfer though. However that would be relatively easy to add I think.

> Change the code to display the summary block as outlined above at the end of the current dry run output

At the moment you'll only get the stats block if you supply `-v`. Are you suggesting that we show it without `-v` when `-dry-run` is in effect? There is precedent for this as the `Skipped copy` logs have been bumped up to NOTICE level.

> Also, display the file size next to each file displayed currently

This isn't straight forward due to the `--dry-run` and `-i` framework. Not impossible though!

Thanks @ncw 
I tried with copy command and did not see the block with # of files to be transferred. I just saw that 0/0 Bytes transferred line. Will have to try with sync.  Even in the block mentioned above in the comment:
1. I don't see the number of files added/modified.
2. I am not sure what 100%  against the line with transfer actually means, as this is simply a dry run.
3. As you mentioned the total size of the transfer is also missing.

I am not aware of -i and --dry-run frameworks so can't comment on the complexity. 

I think the -v flag presence is kind of an extra unnecessary thing to do for this basic info. Albeit its not a terrible thing as long as the information especially the total size of the transfer is displayed.

@ncw Is there any way that you could at least help with a fix to display the total amount of data to be transferred which you referred as a relatively easy fix. I am fine if it works only if -v flag. I am not a Go expert to help with the fix. But I need the total size at least to proceed. Appreciate your help in advance

What needs to be done here 

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/e3a5bb9b489c7de784fe0fd7eea9a9948ab0b587/fs/operations/operations.go#L365-L367

and here

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/e3a5bb9b489c7de784fe0fd7eea9a9948ab0b587/fs/operations/operations.go#L543-L545

The current stats need to be incremented.

The current way to do this would be

```go
in := tr.Account(ctx, nil)
in.ServerSideCopyStart()
in.ServerSideCopyEnd(dst.Size())
```

Though maybe that should be factored into a `in.DryRun` method.

So I think 6 lines of code added and its job done!

Thanks @ncw 

So how do I pull these changes? Just simply download the beta version of docker container docker pull rclone/rclone:beta or do I have to pull the latest version? If its beta, when should I expect it to become latest? Thanks again.
These have not been done anywhere. It was just a suggestion of the required changes in case you want to attempt to do them yourself.

Thanks, @darthShadow for clarification. As I mentioned earlier I have no clue about Go and don't have a way to do the necessary testing. I would be happy to sponsor if you or @ncw or anyone else who could do it.
@darthShadow @ncw any of you mind if I give this a try?

issue.title: --dry-run stats feature

milestone.title: Soon
milestone.description: Issues which are a good idea but haven't been assigned a specific release yet.

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
As posted here in the forums: https://forum.rclone.org/t/dry-run-stats/4214

My feature request is for more information when running `sync`, `copy` or `move`  with `dry-run` to display the outcome of the command, e.g how many GBs of data will be synced to destination and how many GBs will be removed at destination.

This would be great to know how much data is remaining for a copy/sync. 



Currently the displayed information is:

```
Transferred:      0 Bytes (0 Bytes/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:              5778
Transferred:         8179
Elapsed time:    37m21.9s
```

A neat feature could look like:

```
Transferred:      0 Bytes (0 Bytes/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:              5778 (9,327.43 GB)
Deleted: 2,172 (182.27 GB)
Transferred:         8179 (12,294.23 GB)
Elapsed time:    37m21.9s
```
